column.name: [ApD_Rmag]
column.summary: aperture difference of Rmag Aperture difference on Rmag (=Rmag-Ap_Rmag, zero for point sources)

column.name: [MajAxis]
column.summary: major axis as observed in 1" seeing

column.name: [MinAxis]
column.summary: minor axis as observed in 1" seeing

column.name: [PA]
column.summary: position angle, measured West to North

column.name: [phot_flag]
column.summary: flags on photometry. Bit 0-7 (corresponding to values 0-128) are original SExtractor flags, bit 9-11 set by COMBO-17 photometry, bit 9 indicates only potential problem from bright neighbours or reflexes from the optics (check images), bit 10 indicates uncorrected hot pixels, bit 11 is set interactively when photometry is erroneous

column.name: [var_flag]
column.summary: variability flag (0=not variable). flag only set for objects which are detected with high S/N and which show clear variability between different observing runs (magnitude difference greater 0.15 mag, at least one magnitude has to be measured with 10 sigma, difference has to be at least 6 sigma)

column.name: [MC_class]
column.summary: multi-colour class. Definition of classes: "Star "=stars (colour of star, stellar shape), "WDwarf "=WD/BHB/sdB star (colour of WD/BHB/sdB, stellar shape), "Galaxy "=galaxies (colour of galaxy, shape irrelevant), "Galaxy (Star?)"=most likely galaxy at z<0.15 (but overlap in colour space with stars), "Galaxy (Uncl!)"=colour undecided (statistically almost always a galaxy), "QSO "=QSOs (colour of QSO, stellar shape), "QSO (Gal?) "=colour of QSOs, extended shape (usually Seyfert 1), "Strange Objects"=very strange spectrum (very unusual intrinsic spectrum or strong photometric artifacts or uncorrected strong variability)

column.name: [MC_z]
column.summary: mean redshift in distribution of p(z)

column.name: [dl]
column.summary: luminosity distance of MC_z. H0=100km/s/Mpc, Omega_m=0.3, Omega_Lambda=0.7

column.name: [UjMag]
column.summary: Absolute Magnitude in Johnson U. Absolute restframe magnitude calculated from redshifted best_fit template, depending on redshift and filter extrapolation outside the COMBO-17 filter set can be necessary, only calculated for objects classified as galaxies.

column.name: [BjMag]
column.summary: Absolute Magnitude in Johnson B. Absolute restframe magnitude calculated from redshifted best_fit template, depending on redshift and filter extrapolation outside the COMBO-17 filter set can be necessary, only calculated for objects classified as galaxies.

column.name: [VjMag]
column.summary: Absolute Magnitude in Johnson V. Absolute restframe magnitude calculated from redshifted best_fit template, depending on redshift and filter extrapolation outside the COMBO-17 filter set can be necessary, only calculated for objects classified as galaxies.

column.name: [usMag]
column.summary: Absolute Magnitude in SDSS u. Absolute restframe magnitude calculated from redshifted best_fit template, depending on redshift and filter extrapolation outside the COMBO-17 filter set can be necessary, only calculated for objects classified as galaxies.

column.name: [gsMag]
column.summary: Absolute Magnitude in SDSS g. Absolute restframe magnitude calculated from redshifted best_fit template, depending on redshift and filter extrapolation outside the COMBO-17 filter set can be necessary, only calculated for objects classified as galaxies.

column.name: [rsMag]
column.summary: Absolute Magnitude in SDSS r. Absolute restframe magnitude calculated from redshifted best_fit template, depending on redshift and filter extrapolation outside the COMBO-17 filter set can be necessary, only calculated for objects classified as galaxies.

column.name: [UbMag]
column.summary: Absolute Magnitude in Bessell U. Absolute restframe magnitude calculated from redshifted best_fit template, depending on redshift and filter extrapolation outside the COMBO-17 filter set can be necessary, only calculated for objects classified as galaxies.

column.name: [BbMag]
column.summary: Absolute Magnitude in Bessell B. Absolute restframe magnitude calculated from redshifted best_fit template, depending on redshift and filter extrapolation outside the COMBO-17 filter set can be necessary, only calculated for objects classified as galaxies.

column.name: [VbMag]
column.summary: Absolute Magnitude in Bessell V. Absolute restframe magnitude calculated from redshifted best_fit template, depending on redshift and filter extrapolation outside the COMBO-17 filter set can be necessary, only calculated for objects classified as galaxies.

column.name: [S280Mag]
column.summary: Absolute Magnitue in 280/40. Absolute restframe magnitude calculated from redshifted best_fit template, depending on redshift and filter extrapolation outside the COMBO-17 filter set can be necessary, only calculated for objects classified as galaxies. Synthetic UV continuum rectangular passband at 260-300 nm.

column.name: [S145Mag]
column.summary: Absolute Magnitude in 145/10. Absolute restframe magnitude in a synthetic narrow rectangular passband at 140-150 nm calculated from redshifted best_fit template, only calculated for objects classified as quasars

column.name: [W420F_E]
column.summary: flux in filter 420/30 in run E. Coding of observing runs: D = 07.10.-22.10.1999 E = 28.01.-11.02.2000 F = 21.09.-30.09.2000 G = 19.01.-20.01.2001 medium-band filters at the WFI are denoted by (central wavelength/FWHM), the unit of the flux is photons per unit area, second and wavelength interval, it is already corrected for the gain of the CCD.
